description:
Human-associated cyclovirus 10 (HACyV-10) is a small, circular, single-stranded DNA virus that belongs to the family Circoviridae. It is a member of the genus Cyclovirus, which includes a group of viruses primarily found in humans and other mammals.

The genome of HACyV-10 is approximately 2 kilobases in size and encodes two major open reading frames (ORFs) that are responsible for the production of the viral replication-associated protein (Rep) and the viral capsid protein (Cap). These proteins are essential for the virus's replication and assembly within the host cells.

HACyV-10 has been detected in various human samples, including fecal, respiratory, and blood specimens, suggesting a potential association with human health. However, the exact role and clinical significance of HACyV-10 in human disease are still under investigation. Further research is needed to elucidate the prevalence, transmission dynamics, and potential pathogenic mechanisms of this virus in human populations.
